Author: ca333#0118
Content:
@CryptoMedication justified and productive feedback and criticism is welcome and highly appreciated. But there is no reason to become insulting and rude. Posts like `[...] as much of a dick as this guy [...]` are insults and will/can not be tolerated. **Take this as a final warning!**

IF you do think you have a good idea that justifies a Komodo Improvement Proposal then please do open a ticket on https://github.com/komodoplatform/komodo/issues - if you have such basic questions plz contact support next time which could have resolved your problem faster by answering directly or referring you to the right person.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
step 1 - read the docs.
step 2 - ask a question in the appropriate channel, and be patient. search discord, read more, and you might figure out who is working on what you are interested in.
step 3 - avoid insulting devs, you might need their insight later - and it wont make other devs inclined to interact.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User these problems plague all insight explorers I have seen on all chains I have seen

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so if you fix them, plz send patches to KMD 😉

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: well, every insight explorer instance uses different code

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: So you actually need to say which versions of which explorer software you mean

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: which insight version on which coin? Every repo is different code.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "unparsed address" is common, many explorers don't render multisig output correctly, or show unparsed address for other reasons

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I have no idea what this particular chain is doing

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but it's problems are not "KMD"'s problem, this is 3rd party software trying to integrate with KMD software

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you are saying the `vin` of `0 DP` is invalid, it's actually a non-zero amount?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: explorer bugs are not komodod bugs. this is not a bug in KMD core. This is a bug in a 3rd party explorer

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Yeah, it sounds like a rendering bug

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i.e. the code which renders the UI of the explorer is not smart enough or something changed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: tiny changes in every chain make every explorer need slight changes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User I say this lovingly: All these problems are the problems of the DP coin, not KMD

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it would be nice if they didn't exist

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but KMD core people do not "own" that code, I don't know who does. Maybe @Decker if it's his explorer code

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you can't expect Decker's code to work perfectly with every single AC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's a starting point

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: verus had to make extensive changes to make their explorer compatible with 50/50 pos, so I expect many changes would be needed to make the explorer not shitty

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: we don't have many pos64 chains doing advanced stuff with explorers, do we?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, the problem is pos64 + explorers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: nobody ever cared, @Deleted User gets the prize! :troll_king:

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: likely that Deckers explorer repo still needs to learn about pos64 chains

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: he is a busy guy

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so if you can send a patch, that really will make things go faster

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sure, sometimes you need to modify both sides

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: insight explorer codebase scares me and i try not to touch it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: last time I did, I broke explorer.myhush.org for 6 months

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User since you are more of a nodejs ninja, it should be much easier for you

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the "only bitcore code" inside komodod is the addressindex, spentindex, timestampindex support. how it is used is external to the komodod

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the explorer is requiring some specific timestamps, then maybe remove that requirement

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the blockchain actually doesnt care about timestamps very much

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is only used for filtering out invalid blocks with invalid timestamps

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User insight codebase is written poorly, and so for instance, for every new bit of data you want out of an RPC response, you need to write getters+setters and update various UI elements. It's horrible. Mostly likely, you have a rendering bug, which might need some help from the "middle-end"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if there is any type of new RPC data or changed format, I would expect this kind of bug

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why should the explorer reject a valid tx due to timestamp

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is good enough for the blockchain to be valid, the explorer needs to be able to display it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: without a specific tx/block that is valid that the explorer is rejecting, we can only guess

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: even with that it is in the explorer that is being too strict

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Hey just read an article about this being used by Hong Kong protesters, it's basically a bluetooth powered Meshnet to send messages and data to one another or broadcast to large groups of people nearby. <https://bridgefy.me/>

Anyone know if we would be able to broadcast transactions over it some how, or some other way to make KMD work with it.  Would be some cool to send directly or even "rain" coins onto users. Here's the article I read. <https://www.forbes.com/sites/johnkoetsier/2019/09/02/hong-kong-protestors-using-mesh-messaging-app-china-cant-block-usage-up-3685/#242f7451135a>

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Regnar it's just a way to share files with bluetooth, run by a centralized US company

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: broadcasting network messages is possible as long as there is connection established between devices.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the first thing to solve is to have stable strong connection between devices

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: bluetooth is used in this case for the smallest payload to transmit over as much network of peers as possible

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the text message.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I don't know how fully p2p it is, or centralized. The company makes a developer kit, to add to your android/iphone apps

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the more load the network will have the more it will become difficult to manage.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: also bigger network routing things is a hard challenge as I understood from previous findings.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: just because "X can't block it" doesn't mean you are not leaving a trail of metadata that will lead to bad things in the future

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Please be very careful of trusting these kinds of apps, or recommending them to people

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Oh I wasn't trying to sell the app to any of us, or proclaim it is great or even good. I was just saying it would be cool to somehow get KMD working with it and ride some marketing coattails/broaden the KMD capability toolkit

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Regnar well, you are asking to allow bluetooth talk to your wallet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the security implications are grave

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: bluetooth is a cesspool of CVEs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: China will use CVEs/0-dayz against that shit

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Seriously, be safe and be paranoid. People will lose their lives over trusting some of these apps

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: being cool and trendy is not worth people dying

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: So the answer is Yes it can be done, no it shouldn't because the security shouldn't be trusted as is. Reality is people are using this, 60k new downloads mostly from Hong Kong in the past week, their lives are already at risk with or without it. The current method of communications are not working because the traditional avenues are censored and/or aren't capable of talking in mass to people. Again, not trying to sell this, just think if people are looking for other solutions, and this being one of them, it would make sense if we can make our tech work with it (safely).

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: "Being cool and trendy is not worth people dying" I dont know if you are saying us adding support is being cool and trendy but will lead to these people dying, or that the people using this are just using it to be cool and trendy and will lead to them dying. I think this just isn't written correctly, I think I understand what you are getting at though

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: People trusting this as a true security solution to replace encrypted communications can be in danger, however using this knowing what it is (an app where anyone can see public messages, probably the meta data, and apps like WeChat can see who has this app downloaded anyway) is effective at what it is doing currently, spreading information to those around you quickly.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: But the CVE part answered my question, thanks Duke

Content: @Regnar people will die because of that app
